name: Protriptyline (Vivactil)
summary: Protriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used primarily in the treatment of depression and sometimes for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) and narcolepsy.
description: Protriptyline, sold under the brand name Vivactil, is a tricyclic antidepressant known for its stimulating properties compared to other TCAs. It works by inhibiting the reuptake of norepinephrine and, to a lesser extent, serotonin, increasing their levels in the synaptic cleft. Due to its activating profile, it is sometimes used in patients with depressive symptoms who experience significant fatigue or lethargy.

contraindications: Concurrent or recent use (within 14 days) of MAOIs

sections.text: Protriptyline inhibits the reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin in the central nervous system, enhancing neurotransmission. It also has anticholinergic and antihistaminic properties.

adult.Depression: 15–40 mg/day in divided doses, not to exceed 60 mg/day

sections.geriatric: Initiate at 5–10 mg/day; titrate cautiously due to increased sensitivity to side effects

sections.text: Antidepressant effect: 2–4 weeks; Stimulant-like effect may be noted within days

other: Increased risk of suicidal thoughts in children, adolescents, and young adults
Caution in patients with cardiovascular disease
Avoid abrupt discontinuation—may cause withdrawal symptoms

items.risk: Increased risk of cardiac conduction abnormalities

sections.pregnancy: Category D; use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution
sections.geriatrics: Greater risk of anticholinergic and cardiac effects—start low and go slow

sections.text: Reduce dose gradually over several weeks to minimize withdrawal symptoms such as headache, nausea, and malaise

items: More activating than other TCAs—avoid in patients with severe anxiety or agitation
May be beneficial in depression with prominent fatigue and hypersomnia
Not commonly used as first-line therapy due to side effect profile
